cards.buttonText: Click Here To Access The Live Chat

cards.html: Please become a supporting subscriber. You get access to exclusive podcasts, digital publications, and live events like this one — and you support this journalism.

To register and attend the event, CLICK HERE to access our live chat page.

Note: Due to a technical glitch, supporting subscribers were previously not able to register online for the event. That has been corrected, so now supporting subscribers can register for the live chat in the embedded Crowdcast window on our live chat page.

cards.buttonText: Click Here To Access The Live Chat

cards.html: If you would like to participate in the live chat, please become a supporting subscriber. You will receive an email with login information for the event.

Help us spread the word! Please forward this email to family and friends.

Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up for free to receive original reporting like this in your inbox every day.

sections: You don't want to miss this one: Tonight at 7:30pm ET (4:30pm PT),

’s supporting subscribers will join in as David Sirota leads a discussion with New York Assemblyman Ron Kim (D), Pennsylvania state Senator Katie Muth (D), and former Securities and Exchange Commission attorney Ted Siedle about history's largest upward transfer of wealth from workers to Wall Street. And it's all happening in secret.
, Kim recently introduced legislation that would require financial firms to disclose what they are doing with hundreds of billions of dollars of Americans’ retirement savings. Separately, Muth is
suing the Pennsylvania Public School Employees’ Retirement System
to ascertain information regarding the pension fund’s high-risk, high-fee investments in private equity, hedge funds, and real estate. Join us as
speaks with Kim and Muth, as well as Siedle, a prominent securities expert and pension whistleblower, about the reinvigorated effort to protect workers’ pensions.
Like all our live chats, the event is exclusively for
supporting subscribers, who will be able to watch the broadcast live, ask questions in real time, and watch a replay of the event.
To register and attend the event,
to access our live chat page.
